title: Jenny McCarthy bows out of New Year's Rockin' Eve to be home with Donnie Wahlberg and son Evan, 17
text:
There will be no New Year's Rockin' Eve for her this year.

Co-host Jenny McCarthy has pulled out of the extravaganza after 10 years with Ryan Seacrest on the Time Square stage.

The 46-year-old comedian is too busy with her new reality show, The Masked Singer.

New direction: Jenny McCarthy sat down with Live With Kelly And Ryan hosts on Monday to talk about her decision to pull out of NBC's New Year's Rockin' Eve extravaganza after 10 years

And she has taken the wishes of her son Evan, 17, into consideration.

The Sirius XM radio star revealed her decision on Live With Kelly And Ryan on Monday.

'We’re shooting Masked Singer 3 in December and January and my son, who is now 17, said, "Can we please stay home this year?"

'He’s going to be 18, he’s going to want nothing to do with me,' Jenny said.

With her new crew: The celebrity said her decision was partly due to the fact that she is busy on her new reality show The Masked singer, here seen with, from left, panelists Ken Jeong, Charlie Collier, Nicole Scherzinger and Robin Thicke

Quite a spectacle: Panelists and contestants at the Masked Singer contest on September 22

So she evidently decided to make the most of her son's company while she still can.

Jenny is on the show's judging panel along with hitmaker Robin Thicke, actor and comedian Ken Jeong and recording artist Nicole Scherzinger.

It wasn't news to Ryan, of course, as he is one of the producers of The Masked Singer as well as co-host and producer of New Year's Rockin' Eve and Jenny had already informed him of her decision.

Proud mom: Jenny revealed that she also quit New Year's Rockin' Eve after her son Evan, 17, asked if they could stay home in St. Charles, Illinois this year

Jenny couldn't say enough good things about her co-host, gushing: 'It was the most wonderful time. Working with Ryan, it’s a dream. And we can’t say that about a lot of people in this business. So I thank you.'

This means that Jenny will get the chance to watch the ball drop with her actor-producer husband Donnie Wahlberg, 50, from the comfort of their own sofa.

The couple tied the knot in St. Charles, Illinois, outside Chicago, on August 31, 2014 and that's where they have now live.
description: The 46-year-old comedian revealed.on Live With Kelly And Ryan on Monday. that she has pulled out of the extravaganza after 10 years with Ryan Seacrest on the Time Square stage.
